newsitem.title: USA: Asian migrants taken from Bermuda to Guantanamo.
newsitem.headline: Asian migrants taken from Bermuda to Guantanamo.

text.p: The United States has transported some 100 Asian migrants intercepted off Bermuda to the U.S. naval base at Guantanamo Bay on Cuba, the State Department said on Wednesday.

Spokesman Nicholas Burns said this was a temporary measure and the refugees would be taken, probably next week, to another location -- which he would not identify -- to be questioned by U.S. officials.
The U.S. Coast Guard towed the cargo vessel Xing Da, carrying the migrants and a crew of suspected smugglers, into sheltered waters off Bermuda after it broke down at sea.
Burns said the refugees, who were "Asian and we suspect Chinese from a particular province in China," had been taken to Guantanamo by Coast Guard aircraft.

"They will not be screened and they will not be interviewed by our law enforcement agencies and our immigration agencies at Guantanamo," Burns told reporters. "They are being held there simply so they can be fed and housed because they were living in unacceptable conditions on this refugee migrant ship."
"They will be taken to another location, probably as early as next week, so that they can be questioned by U.S. government authorities," Burns said. "This is a very mysterious case."
